wikipedia_page.main: Royston John Hughes, Baron Islwyn, DL (9 June 1925 – 19 December 2003) was a British Labour Party politician from Wales, and a trade union organiser. He served as Member of Parliament (MP) for Newport from 1966 to 1983, and for Newport East from 1983 until his retirement at the 1997 general election. He accepted a life peerage upon his retirement.

response: *19 December – Roy Hughes, Baron Islwyn, politician, 78

Famous people from Pontllanfraith include James Dean Bradfield (the lead singer of Manic Street Preachers) and Julian Hodge, founder of the Bank of Wales. Neil Kinnock, the Labour politician, also had a house in the village. Roy Hughes, Baron Islwyn of Casnewydd, was born there. Artie Moore wireless operator received a distress message from the Titanic in the village.
* Roy Hughes, Baron Islwyn of Casnewydd (politician)
* Roy Hughes, Baron Islwyn (1925–2003), British Labour Party politician and union organiser, MP for Newport 1966–1983, for Newport East 1983–1997
